head.title: Books That Jump Up at You

hedline.hl1: Books That Jump Up at You

block.p: CONEY ISLAND is one of the many Brooklyn locales that gets a three-dimensional treatment (above) in the new book ''Brooklyn Pops Up!,'' a publication of the Brooklyn Public Library and Little Simon/Simon & Schuster. The library is also presenting the exhibition ''Brooklyn Pops Up! The History and Art of the Movable Book,'' curated by the Movable Book Society. Books on display include ''La Cosmographia,'' circa 1575, which focused on math and science, and ''Elvis: Musical Pop-Up Book,'' from 1985.

The library is also presenting the exhibition ''Brooklyn Pops Up! The History and Art of the Movable Book,'' curated by the Movable Book Society. Books on display include ''La Cosmographia,'' circa 1575, which focused on math and science, and ''Elvis: Musical Pop-Up Book,'' from 1985.
Movable books, with pop-ups, paper instruments or other moving parts, were created in the 13th century for adults. The thematic displays include Childhood Classics and Tales of Adventure and Courage.

''Brooklyn Pops Up!'' Saturday through Dec. 30, Monday through Thursday 9 a.m. to 8 p.m., Friday through Sunday 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Lobby Gallery at the Central Library, Grand Army Plaza, Brooklyn; free; (718) 230-2767.
